intro: Sphaeranthus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is characterized by its spherical, spiny seed heads that resemble small globes, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually small and white or pale blue, appearing in clusters. Sphaeranthus abyssinicus is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ecological importance in its native environment.
